title: High school football: Davis outduels Hunter in Region 2 showdown
text:
After spotting Hunter an 8-0 halftime lead the Davis Darts behind running back Riley Smith and quarterback Kallin Fisher got the offense going, scoring 28, second half points to defeat the Wolverines 28-15 to take command of Region 2.

Davis quarterback Kallin Fisher
After spotting Hunter an 8-0 first-half lead, Davis' offense got untracked by scoring 28 second-half points and turning back the Wolverines 28-15 in a battle for the top spot in region 2.
Riley Smith scored on touchdown runs of 14 and three yards, but it was the long-ball of quarterback Kallin Fisher and a game-ending touchdown run from the senior that brought the Darts back after a slow start.
"Hunter has a lot of guys that go both ways so we hoped we'd have the energy to make a comeback," Fisher said. "I told the offensive line at halftime this is our senior year, do we want to win a region championship and they all said yes so that's what we did."
While the second half turned into an offensive explosion, Hunter dominated play in the first 24 minutes with a steady ground game and just enough passing from quarterback McKay Meidlinger to keep the chains moving.
After a nice opening drive that featured a 30-yard gain on a fake punt from Hunter's Olson Williams , the Wolverines missed a field goal.
Following a three-and-out from the Davis offense, Hunter found the end zone.
The Wolverines took over on their 42-yard line and promptly strung together a nine-play, 58-yard drive with a nice mix of running from Duke Atiga and Jerome Fauatea . Meidlinger completed a 22-yard pass to Fauatea before Williams scored on an 8-yard run around right end. Williams added the two-point run and Hunter led 8-0 late in the first quarter.
Davis put together their best drive of the first half with a couple of nice runs from Smith and Fisher. The Darts drive stalled at the 19-yard line after which Hayden Grange missed a 36-yard field goal.
The Darts came out throwing in the first half and pushed deep into Hunter territory before Wolverines defensive back David Mapa picked off an errant Fisher pass.
Facing a fourth and long deep in their own territory, Williams attempted to pick up the yardage with a fake punt that Davis stuffed setting the Darts up at their own 16 with 6:07 remaining in the third.
Two plays later, Smith punched it across on a nifty 14-yard run that brought the Darts within one at 8-7.
After a three-and-out from the Hunter offense, Davis was back in business at the Hunter 42-yard line.
On the first play from scrimmage, Fisher dropped a 40-yard bomb into the waiting arms of Mitch Nelson who caught the pass in between two Hunter defenders and took the ball to the 2-yard line. Nick Roberts ' two-yard touchdown run gave the Darts their first lead of the night at 14-8.
"We drew up that play and Mitch told me to put it on a line so I put it on a line and he went up and got it," Fisher said.
The lead lasted all of about 10 seconds as Meidlinger hooked up with Mapa on an 80-yard pass play that gave Hunter the lead 15-14.
From there it was all Davis as Smith scored his second rushing touchdown of the night to extend the lead. Fisher added a late 4-yard rushing score as Davis improved to 5-0 in region 2 with one game remaining, next week against Layton.
"Hunter is a great team that has good players and a great coach," Davis coach Tyler Gladwell said. "Give them a lot of credit, our kids had to fight tonight to get this win."
A Davis offense that had just three first downs and 50 yards rushing in the first half turned it around with a dominating performance in the second half. Davis finished with 16 first downs, 161 yards of rushing and 114 yards of timely passing yards.
"We didn't have a lot of rhythm in the first half because our possessions were limited," Gladwell said. "We were able to run the ball a little bit in the second half and just having those extra possessions helped our pass offense get going."
